source: Trades, Creative & Hands-On Skills Library — Work Blueprint
description: Skilled trades, creative arts, culinary, and hands-on competencies. Valuable both professionally and as skill adjacencies (spatial reasoning, precision, project management, material science, design thinking).

skills.name: Carpentry
skills.definition: Cutting, shaping, and assembling wood structures and furnishings to precise specifications. Develops spatial reasoning, measurement, and project planning.

skills.name: Cabinet Making
skills.definition: Designing and constructing storage units, furniture, and built-ins. Requires advanced joinery, finishing, and exacting tolerances.

skills.name: Furniture Restoration
skills.definition: Assessing, repairing, and refinishing antique or damaged furniture. Combines materials science, historical knowledge, and craft.

skills.name: Framing
skills.definition: Constructing the structural frame of buildings including walls, floors, and roofs according to architectural plans.

skills.name: Finish Carpentry
skills.definition: Installing trim, molding, doors, and detail woodwork that requires high precision and aesthetic judgment.

skills.name: Blueprint Reading
skills.definition: Interpreting architectural and engineering drawings, schematics, and technical plans to guide construction or fabrication.

skills.name: Masonry
skills.definition: Working with brick, stone, block, and concrete to construct walls, walkways, and structural elements.

skills.name: Concrete Work
skills.definition: Mixing, pouring, finishing, and curing concrete for foundations, slabs, and structural elements.

skills.name: Drywall Installation
skills.definition: Hanging, taping, mudding, and finishing drywall panels to create smooth interior wall surfaces.

skills.name: Flooring Installation
skills.definition: Installing hardwood, tile, laminate, carpet, or vinyl flooring including sub-floor preparation.

skills.name: Roofing
skills.definition: Installing, repairing, and maintaining roofing systems including shingles, metal, and membrane materials.

skills.name: Electrical Wiring
skills.definition: Installing and maintaining electrical circuits, panels, outlets, and fixtures following code requirements and safety standards.

skills.name: Plumbing
skills.definition: Installing and repairing water supply, drainage, and gas systems in residential and commercial structures.

skills.name: HVAC/Refrigeration
skills.definition: Installing, maintaining, and repairing heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration systems.

skills.name: Welding
skills.definition: Joining metals using heat and filler material (MIG, TIG, stick, or oxy-acetylene processes). Requires metallurgical knowledge and precision hand control.

skills.name: Metal Fabrication
skills.definition: Cutting, bending, and assembling metal components to specifications using tools including plasma cutters, brakes, and grinders.

skills.name: Automotive Repair
skills.definition: Diagnosing and repairing mechanical, electrical, and electronic systems in vehicles.

skills.name: Small Engine Repair
skills.definition: Servicing and repairing small gasoline and diesel engines in lawn equipment, generators, and power tools.

skills.name: CNC Machining
skills.definition: Programming and operating computer numerically controlled machines to produce precision metal and plastic parts.

skills.name: 3D Printing / Additive Manufacturing
skills.definition: Designing for and operating FDM, SLA, or SLS printers; understanding material properties and post-processing.

skills.name: Interior Painting
skills.definition: Preparing surfaces and applying paint, stain, or specialty coatings to interior walls, ceilings, and trim.

skills.name: Exterior Painting
skills.definition: Preparing and coating exterior surfaces of buildings including siding, trim, and masonry.

skills.name: Decorative Painting
skills.definition: Applying specialty finishes including faux textures, murals, stenciling, and color washing to create artistic wall treatments.

skills.name: Auto Body / Refinishing
skills.definition: Repairing vehicle body panels and applying paint systems to achieve factory-quality finish.

skills.name: Powder Coating
skills.definition: Applying electrostatically charged dry powder to metal surfaces and curing in an oven for durable protective finish.

skills.name: Wallpapering / Wall Covering
skills.definition: Measuring, cutting, and applying wallpaper and decorative wall coverings requiring pattern matching and surface prep.

skills.name: Culinary Arts
skills.definition: Professional cooking techniques encompassing knife skills, heat control, flavor development, and kitchen management.

skills.name: Baking & Pastry
skills.definition: Applying precise measurements and techniques to produce breads, pastries, and confections requiring chemistry-level precision.

skills.name: Fermentation & Brewing
skills.definition: Managing biological fermentation processes for beer, wine, bread, kombucha, cheese, or fermented foods.

skills.name: Food Safety & HACCP
skills.definition: Implementing and managing hazard analysis and critical control point food safety systems.

skills.name: Menu Development
skills.definition: Creating menus that balance nutrition, cost, seasonality, and culinary technique for target audiences.

skills.name: Knife Skills
skills.definition: Precision cutting, dicing, julienning, and chiffonade techniques demonstrating fine motor control and speed.

skills.name: Drawing & Illustration
skills.definition: Creating representational and conceptual artwork using pencil, ink, charcoal, or digital tools.

skills.name: Oil Painting
skills.definition: Working with oil-based paints on canvas or board, including color mixing, glazing, impasto, and layering techniques.

skills.name: Watercolor Painting
skills.definition: Applying transparent washes and wet-on-wet techniques in water-based media requiring fluid control and planning.

skills.name: Digital Illustration
skills.definition: Creating artwork using software (Procreate, Illustrator, Photoshop) with drawing tablets and digital tools.

skills.name: Sculpture
skills.definition: Creating three-dimensional forms in clay, stone, metal, wood, or found materials through additive or subtractive processes.

skills.name: Ceramics / Pottery
skills.definition: Forming clay by hand building or wheel throwing, then firing to create functional or decorative ceramic objects.

skills.name: Printmaking
skills.definition: Creating multiples using relief, intaglio, screen printing, or lithography processes.

skills.name: Photography
skills.definition: Composing and capturing images with knowledge of exposure, lighting, lens optics, and post-processing.

skills.name: Video Production
skills.definition: Planning, filming, and editing video content including cinematography, sound recording, and post-production.

skills.name: Graphic Design
skills.definition: Creating visual communications using typography, layout, and imagery for print or digital media.

skills.name: Screen Printing
skills.definition: Creating and applying stencil-based prints to fabric or paper using squeegees and ink.

skills.name: Color Theory
skills.definition: Understanding and applying principles of hue, value, saturation, and color relationships in visual work.

skills.name: Sewing & Tailoring
skills.definition: Cutting, fitting, and assembling fabric into garments or soft goods with precision seaming and finishing.

skills.name: Knitting / Crochet
skills.definition: Creating textiles through interlocking loops of yarn using needles or hooks following written patterns.

skills.name: Weaving
skills.definition: Interlacing warp and weft threads on a loom to create cloth with specific patterns and structures.

skills.name: Leatherworking
skills.definition: Cutting, tooling, stitching, and finishing leather to create goods such as bags, belts, and footwear.

skills.name: Upholstery
skills.definition: Repairing or creating cushioned furniture by attaching fabric and padding to frames.

skills.name: Acting
skills.definition: Embodying characters through voice, body, and emotional access for stage, film, or broadcast performance.

skills.name: Dance
skills.definition: Performing choreographed or improvisational movement forms including ballet, contemporary, or social dance.

skills.name: Stage Management
skills.definition: Coordinating all production elements of a theatrical show including scheduling, calling cues, and managing personnel.

skills.name: Sound Design
skills.definition: Creating and curating sound environments for theater, film, or installations using synthesis, recording, and mixing.

skills.name: Lighting Design
skills.definition: Designing and programming theatrical or architectural lighting to communicate mood, focus, and narrative.

skills.name: Landscaping / Horticulture
skills.definition: Designing, installing, and maintaining outdoor spaces including plant selection, grading, and irrigation.

skills.name: Organic Gardening
skills.definition: Growing vegetables, fruits, and flowers without synthetic inputs using soil management, companion planting, and integrated pest management.

skills.name: Beekeeping
skills.definition: Managing honey bee colonies for pollination or honey production, requiring knowledge of insect biology and hive health.

skills.name: Arboriculture / Tree Care
skills.definition: Pruning, treating, cabling, and removing trees safely using climbing techniques and aerial equipment.

skills.name: Animal Husbandry
skills.definition: Raising livestock or poultry including feeding, health monitoring, breeding, and facility management.

skills.name: Electronics / Soldering
skills.definition: Building, repairing, and modifying electronic circuits by soldering components and reading schematics.

skills.name: Arduino / Raspberry Pi
skills.definition: Programming and building physical computing projects using microcontrollers and single-board computers.

skills.name: Ham Radio / Amateur Radio
skills.definition: Operating licensed amateur radio stations for communication, emergency services, or experimental purposes.

skills.name: Drone Operation
skills.definition: Flying and maintaining unmanned aerial systems for photography, inspection, agriculture, or recreation.

skills.name: Lock Sport / Physical Security
skills.definition: Understanding and demonstrating physical security vulnerabilities through lock picking, bypass, and security assessment.
